business.headline: Explained: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank share price fell over 6% todayThe decline came after the private lender posted a weaker-than-expected set of results for the April–June quarter. The stock decline comes in the wake of a 7% year-on-year drop in standalone net profit to Rs 3,282 crore, even though the bank reported steady growth in core lending activity.

Sensex opens over 300 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Kotak Bank down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.28 points to 81,237.81, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 43.60 points to 24,793.40 as of 9:30 am.

Samsung to power Tesla's future with $16.5 billion chip deal: ReportThis long-term contract comes at a crucial time for Samsung. While the company is one of the world's biggest makers of memory chips, its foundry business, which produces chips for other companies, has struggled to keep up with demand and competition.

Bhavish Aggarwal's Krutrim lays off over 100 employees in fresh job cuts: ReportThe layoffs at Krutrim affected a large part of the firm's linguistics team, which had only recently joined the company.

GNG Electronics IPO allotment out. Here's how to check status, what GMP signalsInvestors who applied for the IPO can check the allotment status through two official platforms: the BSE website and the website of the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

TCS layoff: What the company is offering to 12,000 affected employeesTCS job cut: The move is part of a broader plan to adapt to changing technology trends and streamline operations as the company aims to become a "future-ready" organisation.

We negotiate confidently: Minister's signal to US after landmark UK trade pactIndia has signed a landmark free trade agreement with the UK, marking a new phase in bilateral economic ties. The government aims to use this momentum to secure future deals with the US and other key partners.

A will, a letter, and a brewing dispute: Sunjay Kapur's mother vs Sona ComstarAs Sunjay Kapur's mother takes on Sona Comstar, the unfolding dispute could shape into a high-stakes clash of legacy, legality, and loss in one of India's storied business families.

Joint home loan or personal loan? What's smarter for young couples buying propertyBuying your first home as a couple is exciting, but figuring out how to finance it? That's where things get tricky. Should you go for a joint home loan or take a personal loan? Let's break it down.

How taxes drove Formula 1 out of IndiaFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

entertainment.headline: True Beauty actor Cha Eun-woo begins military service: I'll be back safeCha Eun-woo, ASTRO's singer and actor, has officially started his mandatory military service. Fans and fellow celebrities have given him an emotional send-off as he prepares to return in 2027.

Sidharth Malhotra visits Siddhivinayak with mother after daughter's birthBollywood actor Sidharth Malhotra visits Mumbai's Siddhivinayak Temple with his mother to seek blessings for his newborn daughter and family. Sidharth and Kiara Advani welcomed their first child on July 16.

Kriti Sanon's rumoured partner Kabir Bahia wishes her birthday with an old picActor Kriti Sanon's rumoured boyfriend, Kabir Bahia, posted a charming holiday snap to celebrate the occasion. The two have been rumoured to be dating for a while.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna's nicknames for each other are all things cuteVijay Deverakonda debuted his nickname for his rumoured girlfriend, Rashmika Mandanna, on X. The 'Pushpa' actor wished him ahead of the release of his upcoming film, 'Kingdom', slated to hit theatres on July 31.

Prithviraj Sukumaran's team rubbishes rumours about false claims on Lucifer 3Director-actor Prithviraj Sukumaran's team addressed rumours about 'L3: Azrael', clarifying misconceptions and urging media accuracy. Recently, it was reported that 'Lucifer 3' would feature underwater sequences.

Raveena Tandon confirms Aranyak Season 2 shelved, says script didn't work outRaveena Tandon has confirmed that season 2 of her hit web series Aranyak is not happening, despite initial hopes and a written script. She shared that the makers couldn't crack a script that matched the high expectations set by the first season.

Ankita Lokhande shares emotional note with Vicky Jain ahead of Laughter Chefs finaleAs 'Laughter Chefs' Season 2 comes to an end, actor Ankita Lokhande shared a emotional note with husband Vicky Jain, thanking fans and the show's team for all the love. She called the show a fun journey that felt like therapy for everyone involved.

Rashmika Mandanna begins Mysaa shooting in Hyderabad, see muhurat picsRashmika Mandanna is set to headline 'Mysaa', a female-led pan-India action thriller rooted in the culture of the Gond tribes. The shooting is set to begin soon with the muhurat ceremony in Hyderabad on July 27.

Salman Khan shares life lesson from father Salim: Wish I heard this earlierSalman Khan shared a heartfelt life lesson from his father Salim Khan, reflecting on how past actions shape one's future and character. He expressed regret over not understanding the advice earlier.

Actor Madhampatty Rangaraj, 2nd wife Joy announce pregnancy hours after wedding postActor Madhampatty Rangaraj, best known for 'Mehandi Circus' and 'Cooku with Comali' got married to celebrity stylist Joy Crizildaa.

Fantastic Four box office Day 2: Marvel film sees mild growth after slow startMarvel's 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' had a slow start at the Indian box office, earning Rs 12.60 crore nett in two days despite global success.

Rashmika Mandanna cheers for Kingdom trailer, Vijay's reply steals heartsVijay Deverakonda's upcoming spy thriller 'Kingdom' has received strong praise from Rashmika Mandanna, who called the trailer 'madness' and lauded his acting. The film will release in theatres on July 31.

Dhanush and GV Prakash jam together ahead of Idly Kadai single release. WatchA video of Dhanush and music composer GV Prakash jamming ahead of the 'Idly Kadai' single release has gone viral, adding to the excitement for the film's music.

Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam: A tragedy that foretold Meena Kumari's doom'Sahib Bibi Aur Ghulam' (1962) endures as a masterpiece born of the shared melancholy of Meena Kumari and Guru Dutt, whose personal battles with tragedy shaped a timeless elegy to love, longing, and destiny.
My little princess: AR Rahman celebrates daughter Raheema's graduationAR Rahman recently celebrated his daughter Raheema's graduation. The singer posted pictures from the ceremony in Switzerland.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 3: Pawan Kalyan's film faces weekend slumpPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on Day 3, earning Rs 9.25 crore nett after a strong Rs 34 crore nett opening.

GoT star Nikolaj Coster-Waldau savours idli at Bengaluru's Rameshwaram Cafe. Watch'Game of Thrones' actor Nikolaj Coster-Waldau surprised Indian fans as he was clicked enjoying South Indian cuisine at Bengaluru's popular Rameshwaram Cafe. Several videos and pictures of his trip have gone viral.

Actor Vineet Kumar, wife Ruchiraa welcome baby boy: He's already stealing heartsActor Vineet Kumar Singh and wife  Ruchiraa Gormaray have been blessed with a baby boy. The 'Chhaava' actor announced the news on social media.

Priyanka-Nick enjoy BLACKPINK's New York concert, dance to APT. WatchPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas attended BLACKPINK's concert in New York, sharing fun moments from the event on social media. Chopra praised Lisa as a queen.

general news.headline: Fiery Op Sindoor debate in Parliament today, Shashi Tharoor unlikely to speakAs Parliament gears up for Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor debate, the focus remains on whether Congress MP Shashi Tharoor will be allowed to speak or not.

2 dead, over 40 injured after electric shock triggers stampede at UP templeTwo people lost their lives and several others were injured in a stampede at a temple in Uttar Pradesh after an electric wire fell on a tin shed.

Tech layoffs: TCS, Microsoft, Intel among 5 slashing thousands of jobs in apparent AI restructureSeveral global tech companies, including TCS, Microsoft, Intel, Meta, and Panasonic, are laying off thousands of employees this year as they adjust to changing business needs and the growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI).

RJD MLA's Panchayat-style threat gets Bihar Sachiv's 'not scared of you' responseAn audio clip, allegedly featuring RJD MLA Bhai Virendra, has gone viral, in which he is heard threatening a panchayat secretary who failed to recognise him during a call about a death certificate request.

Manchester Test: A draw that felt like a winFrom 0 for 2 to 425 for 4 in the second innings, India turned what looked a defeat into a stirring draw in Manchester. A performance built on grit and defiance, it felt like a win and a momentum shift before the Oval finale.

Live: Lok Sabha braces for Op Sindoor debate, Rajnath Singh to speak at noonParliament Session 2025 Live Updates: After a week of disruptions, Parliament's Monsoon Session is now poised to witness a high-stakes debate beginning today, with the focus on the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor — two issues deeply tied to national security and foreign policy. Both the ruling BJP-led National Democratic Alliance and the Opposition are preparing for an intense face-off in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The Congress has already issued a three-line whip, directing its Lok Sabha MPs to remain present in the House for the next three days. In a rare show of consensus, the two sides have agreed to a 16-hour debate in each House — though such sessions typically spill over beyond the allotted time. Senior leaders from both camps are expected to lead the charge during what promises to be a politically charged week in Parliament. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in as we bring you the latest updates.

Do we switch off our economy? Indian envoy's clapback on Russian oil questionDismissing Western criticism of India's ties with Russia, its High Commissioner to the UK said New Delhi cannot shut down its economy over geopolitical concerns.

Why BJP old guard in Punjab, national leadership aren't buying the SAD reunion talkFor the BJP, the goal isn't just to win elections in the state but build a political identity that resonates with Sikhs independently of the Akali Dal

What is 'Golf Force One', the armoured buggy spotted with Trump in Scotland?As Donald Trump teed off at the Turnberry golf course in Scotland, what stole the show was the jet-black reinforced golf cart, standing out amid a posse of army trucks.

While the company is one of the world's biggest makers of memory chips, its foundry business, which produces chips for other companies, has struggled to keep up with demand and competition.

Efforts went in vain: Mallikarjun Kharge rues missing out on Karnataka top jobSuggesting his hopes of rising to become the Karnataka Chief Minister in 1999 suffered a setback, Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said he worked tirelessly as the Congress Legislative Party (CLP) leader for five years, but all his efforts went in vain.

Forget Ghaziabad's fake embassy, you can even build a country of your ownHarsh Vardhan Jain ran embassies of fake nations from a house in Ghaziabad. People who are more ingenious have built their own countries, and Nithyananda's Kailasa is just one of them.

India refuse early draw in Manchester, Stokes explodes. Who was right?India vs England: Shubman Gill's India pulled off a heroic draw in the Manchester Test match. Ravindra Jadeja got into a verbal tussle with Ben Stokes in the late hours of the final day.

14,000 men receive payout under Ladki Bahin scheme, Ajit Pawar vows actionWhile Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar has promised to recover the amount and take action against the fraudsters, the opposition has sought a CBI probe into it.

Pune woman, 70, wraps snake around neck to spread awareness. Video goes viralShakuntala Sutar calmly picked up a non-venomous rat snake that had wandered into the premises of her house. Instead of calling for a snake rescuer, she chose to take matters into her own hands, quite literally.

Watch: Ben Stokes offers draw, India decline to let Jadeja, Sundar score hundredsEngland vs India, 4th Test: Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar declined Ben Stokes's draw offer on Day 5 of the Manchester Test. Their decision to continue batting led to both players scoring centuries, intensifying England's disappointment.

US, EU seal trade framework with 15% tariff to end standoffThe new trade deal sets a 15% tariff on EU goods entering the US, avoiding a steeper 30% rate. The announcement came after Trump met European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Scotland.

162 trips abroad, 25 shell firms, Rs 300 crore scam: Fake envoy's web of deceitAccording to officials, Harshvardhan Jain visited the UAE 54 times and the UK 22 times between 2005 and 2015. The probe also uncovered 25 shell companies linked to Jain in foreign countries.

It's official! We're wearing jeans to weddings nowAmid a sea of sparkling lehengas, figure-hugging gowns, sherwanis, bejewelled sehras and reimagined sarees, designer duo Falguni and Shane Peacock introduced jeans to the runway.

A will, a letter, and a brewing dispute: Sunjay Kapur's mother vs Sona ComstarAs Sunjay Kapur's mother takes on Sona Comstar, the unfolding dispute could shape into a high-stakes clash of legacy, legality, and loss in one of India's storied business families.

VIT student claims to pose as Xavi in email for India coach job: ReportA twist in the tale has emerged with reports suggesting that the person who sent in the email as Xavi Hernandez is just a 19-year-old student from VIT in Vellore, Tamil Nadu.

All you need to know about PM Internship Scheme 2025 before registrations openThe PM Internship Scheme 2025 is offering young Indians a chance to gain hands-on industry experience with a monthly stipend of Rs5,000. Here's a quick guide to answer key questions on registration, eligibility, duration, and benefits.

sports.headline: Injured Pant sends parting message to Team India after heroic Manchester drawRishabh Pant sent a parting message to the Indian team after their heroic draw in the Manchester Test. Pant showed grit and fought through pain to score a valiant fifty in the first innings of the fourth Test.

Manchester Test: A draw that felt like a winFrom 0 for 2 to 425 for 4 in the second innings, India turned what looked a defeat into a stirring draw in Manchester. A performance built on grit and defiance, it felt like a win and a momentum shift before the Oval finale.

Workload management can pause, India need Jasprit Bumrah in Oval Test deciderHaving secured a draw in the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford in Manchester, should India push Jasprit Bumrah to play in the fifth Test at the Oval with a chance of levelling the series still alive? With the series on the line, workload management can take a backseat, especially with no major tournaments lined up for the next four months.

Ben Stokes on asking for early draw: Didn't want to risk front-line bowlersEngland captain Ben Stokes revealed that he didn't want to risk his front-line bowlers and hence asked for an early draw in the fourth Test against India at OId Trafford in Manchester.

Tejaswin Shankar breaks national record, betters his previous markIndia's Tejaswin Shankar broke his own national decathlon record with 7826 points in Poland. This achievement marks a new milestone for Indian athletics and raises hopes for future international success.

Gambhir should tone it down, India succeeding despite his blunders: ManjrekarFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has urged Gautam Gambhir to tone down during his press conference while answering tough questions and also highlighted his tactical blunders.

Bruised, but battle-ready: Ben Stokes says he won't miss Oval Test deciderEngland captain Ben Stokes opened up on his availability for the last Test of the five-match series against India at the Oval. Stokes was adjudged Player of the Match in the fourth Test for scoring a century and taking a five-wicket haul after India secured a hard-fought draw on Day 5.

Watch: Coach Gambhir blasts critics in fiery press conference after Manchester Test drawEngland vs India: Gautam Gambhir was at his typically combative best after India eked out a heroic draw in the Manchester Test. From tearing into critics of Shubman Gill to emphasising that India would head into the fifth Test in London with confidence, Gambhir was characteristically straightforward and fiery on Sunday, 27 July.

Ben Stokes acted like a spoilt kid: Pundits slam him over Manchester draw dramaEngland vs India: Sanjay Manjrekar criticised Ben Stokes for his behaviour after India declined a draw offer in the Manchester Test. Jadeja and Sundar reached centuries, helping India salvage a draw and keep the series alive.

Injured Rishabh Pant ruled out of 5th Test, N Jagadeesan named replacementRishabh Pant has been ruled out of the fifth Test after scans confirmed a fractured metatarsal in his right foot, sustained during the fourth Test in Manchester. In his absence, Tamil Nadu wicketkeeper-batter Narayan Jagadeesan has been drafted into the squad for the series finale at The Oval.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
